Dear Madam:
div1.p:
We have your letter of the 5th inst., for the suggestions
in which please accept our thanks. We are sending copy of the same
to Dr. A. S. v.Mansfelde, who is in direct touch with the Senator
and Congressman who will introduce in Congress the necessary measure.

We are asking him to communicate with the gentlemen men-
tioned by you, stating at the same time that we shall be pleased
to also do so when we hear from him as to just what has been accom-
plished thus far.

A meeting of the American Medical Association was to be
held in Chicago on the 12th inst., at which time Dr. Mansfelde in-
tended favorable action should be taken by that Association. We
are awaiting to hear from him as to what occurred at the meeting in
question.

We think it would be advisable if, after you hear from
Dr. Mansfelde, that you also write to the people in Baltimore re-
ferred to by you, personally enlisting their active support of the
bill to increase your pension.

We shall take much pleasure in keeping you posted as
to the progress made when the bill is pending in Congress.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, THE MERCHANTS' ASSOCIATION OF NEW YORK,
By
Secretary. staff
